intro: Viguiera obscura, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, purple to pink blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Viguiera obscura is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to support local pollinators.
